Checks.ProcessingCommand: expectedresult='Timeout (watchdog) : 60'; result=0; for i in $(cat /etc/sysconfig/sbd | grep '^SBD_DEVICE' | cut -d '=' -f 2 | tr -d '"' | tr ';' ' '); do resultcommand=$(sbd -d ${i} dump | grep watchdog); if [[ $resultcommand == $expectedresult ]]; then result=$((result + 1)); else result=$((result - 10)); fi; done; if [ $result -gt 0 ]; then echo 'OK'; else echo 'ERROR'; fi
Checks.ProcessingCommandOutput: for i in $(cat /etc/sysconfig/sbd | grep '^SBD_DEVICE' | cut -d '=' -f 2 | tr -d '"' | tr ';' ' '); do echo $(sbd -d ${i} dump | grep watchdog); done

Checks.ProcessingCommand: sudo su - $(sudo getent passwd | grep db2 | cut -d ':' -f1) -c 'db2pd -alldbs -hadr' | grep 'HADR_TIMEOUT' | awk '{print $NF}'
sudo su - $(sudo getent passwd | grep db2 | cut -d ':' -f1) -c 'db2pd -alldbs -hadr' | grep 'HADR_TIMEOUT' | awk '{print $NF}'
sudo su - $(sudo getent passwd | grep db2 | cut -d ':' -f1) -c 'db2pd -alldbs -hadr' | grep 'PEER_WINDOW(seconds)' | awk '{print $NF}'

output=$(su - $(getent passwd | grep db2 | cut -d : -f1) -c 'db2pd -dbmcfg' | grep INSTANCE_MEMORY | awk '{print $NF}'); [[ $output -le 100 ]] && echo $output || echo $(awk -v output=$output 'BEGIN {print output * 4096 / 1024 / 1024 / 1024}')
Checks.AdditionalInfo: The instance memoery size should be more than 64GB for production systems or more than 75% of total RAM.

Checks.ProcessingCommand: [ $((256 * $(free -g | grep Mem: | awk '{print $2}')))  -ge $(/sbin/sysctl kernel.shmmni -n) ] && echo OK || echo $(/sbin/sysctl kernel.shmmni -n)
Checks.AdditionalInfo: Minimum setting 256 * <size of RAM in GB>
